messages.subject: Re: re:  Unschooling / vet or not?      [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 324
messages.msgSnippet: ... to ... years, ... When dd was in her animal phase, we talked to some of the trainers at the Living Desert, a good place to go if you re in the Palm
messages.messageBody:
Nancy writes:

> There's zoo work, too, another avenue dd has considered. Moorpark College
> may be in her future. The fact that first years may not so much as SPEAK
to
> an animal puts her off a little; that privilege belongs to the second
years,
> who train the critters as part of the curriculum.

When dd was in her animal phase, we talked to some of the trainers at the
Living Desert, a good place to go if you're in the Palm Springs, CA area in
the not-summer. These folks were training and exhibiting many varieties of
rats, foxes, lizards, snakes, exotic cats, birds, you name it, and their
methods were a joy to see. We sure had fun seeing their animal shows. They
all seemed to be having fun, too -- so we asked them about how they trained
for it. Moorpark seemed to be the way to go.
( <A HREF="http://www.livingdesert.org/home.html">The Living Desert Zoo and
Gardens Home Page</A> )

Marge
